wikipedia_page.main: Sir Anthony Charles Galsworthy  (born 20 December 1944) is a retired British diplomat (former ambassador to China) and amateur naturalist.

link_mentions.page: List of ambassadors of the United Kingdom to China

response: Galsworthy is the father of the diplomat, Sir Anthony Galsworthy. His brother, Sir John Galsworthy KCVO, CMG was the British Ambassador to Mexico 1972–1977.

Galsworthy's brother, Sir Arthur Galsworthy KCVO, was the Governor of the Pitcairn Islands and High Commissioner to New Zealand from 1970 to 1973. In 1973, he was appointed Ambassador to the Republic of Ireland, where he served from 1973 to 1976. Arthur Galsworthy is the father of the diplomat Sir Anthony Galsworthy.

link_mentions.page: Principal Private Secretary to the Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs

response: Pingasa chloroides is a moth of the family Geometridae first described by Anthony Galsworthy in 1998. It is found in China (Hong Kong, Fujian, Guangdong).Catalogue of Life – China Node
In 2013, Vladimir Mironov and Anthony Galsworthy classified it as a junior synonym of E. laricarata.

Athetis hongkongensis, the Hong Kong marsh moth is a noctuid moth found in Hong Kong. The species was first described by Anthony Galsworthy in 1997.Galsworthy, A. C. (1997). "New and revised species of macrolepidoptera from Hong Kong". Memoirs of the Hong Kong Natural History Society. 21: 127-151.
